div.p: All of the information required to publish a web application to a Web Site for each enabled publication method is stored in an XML file known as a publish profile. The publish profile contains the URLs, user credentials and database strings required to connect to and authenticate against each of the endpoints for which a publication method is enabled. Though a publish profile uses the XML file format it is saved with the extension “.PublishSettings”. A publish profile can be manually opened and examined using Notepad or Internet Explorer. Microsoft WebMatrix supports reading publish profiles to automate publishing web applications to web sites.
To download the publish profile for a Web site follow these steps:

ol.li: Under the quick glance section of the Dashboard management page click Download publish profile.
When prompted, save the publish profile file to the local computer.
